Param.h3: Who is listed in UC Davis Profiles?

ul.li: UC Davis Profiles was created for research networking so we initially focused on adding UC Davis faculty members, researchers with academic leadership appointments, and non-faculty academic researchers.
We are happy to include research staff and other individuals in the UC Davis community, on request and if possible. Send requests, with full name and employee ID, to profiles@ucdavis.edu

Param.h3: Who can view UC Davis Profiles?

ul.li: UC Davis Profiles is searchable on the web and can be viewed by the general public as well as the UC Davis community.

Param.h3: How do I sign in to UC Davis Profiles?

ul.li: Click the Sign in link on any UC Davis Profiles page. Then enter your single sign on (SSO) username and password.
If you have never used SSO, or for password support, go to UC Davis Identity and Access Management or contact your Home Departmental Administrator.

Param.h3: Why are there missing or incorrect publications in my profile? How can I correct this?

ul.li: UC Davis Profiles uses a complex mix of names, institution, and publication information to find your publications in PubMed's repository. Unfortunately, there is no easy way to match all articles in PubMed to Profiles authors with complete precision and accuracy.
People who have common names, who published under multiple names or whose articles were written while at other institutions are most likely to have incomplete publication lists.

You can make corrections by searching PubMed from within Profiles to add, edit or delete publications. By curating publications manually, you are helping UC Davis Profiles to identify which concepts and co-authors are correctly associated with your profile, thereby increasing the likelihood of finding the right publications on subsequent attempts.
UC Davis Profiles is managed by the Research Technology program of UCSF's Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI) on behalf of the UC Davis Clinical and Translational Science Center.
